New URI: *** REQUIRED. Contains the new Syriaca.org URI to be assigned to each row.
persName syriaca-headword.en-x-gedsh: REQUIRED. (text) The display name used in Syriaca page titles, etc. Each row must have at least 1 cell with a "persName syriaca-headword" value, in either GEDSH transliteration ("en-x-gedsh") or Syriac ("syr"), preferably both. This can have a source but doesn't have to. (See http://syriaca.org/exist/apps/srophe/documentation/headwords.html)
persName syriaca-headword.syr: REQUIRED. (text) The display name used in Syriaca page titles, etc. Each row must have at least 1 cell with a "persName syriaca-headword" value, in either GEDSH transliteration ("en-x-gedsh") or Syriac ("syr"), preferably both. This can have a source but doesn't have to. (See http://syriaca.org/exist/apps/srophe/documentation/headwords.html)
persName anonymous-description.en: REQUIRED IF the person is unnamed. Give a short description here that will be used along with the person's number to provide a heading.
trait.en: OPTIONAL. (e.g., "anonymous") A personal quality (typically non-volitional) that is usually not limited to a specific timeframe. Used especially to mark persons as "anonymous".
persName.Source 1.en: OPTIONAL. (text) The person's name in English, according to Source 1.
Source 1: REQUIRED IF any columns use this source. (Syriaca.org bibl number) The number (only) of the bibl record for this source. The converter adds "http://syriaca.org/bibl" automatically. For example, Select Letters of Severus 1.2 is "667".
citedRange pp.Source 1: REQUIRED IF any columns use Source 1. (e.g., page or section number) Whatever comes after "citedRange_" in the column name and before the dot (.) is put into the @unit attribute (e.g., "pp", "section", or "entry"). Accepts a URL linking to this location (as @target) inside square brackets. E.g., "21 [http://archive.org/...]" If there is no citedRange for a source, the source is not processed. Enter "none" if the source should be processed anyway.
persName.Source 2.syr: OPTIONAL. (text) The person's name in Syriac, according to Source 2.
Source 2: REQUIRED IF any columns use this source. (Syriaca.org bibl number) The number (only) of the bibl record for this source. The converter adds "http://syriaca.org/bibl" automatically. For example, Select Letters of Severus 1.2 is "667".
citedRange pp.Source 2: REQUIRED IF any columns use Source 2. (e.g., page or section number) Whatever comes after "citedRange_" in the column name and before the dot (.) is put into the @unit attribute (e.g., "pp", "section", or "entry"). Accepts a URL linking to this location (as @target) inside square brackets. E.g., "21 [http://archive.org/...]" If there is no citedRange for a source, the source is not processed. Enter "none" if the source should be processed anyway.
person ana: OPTIONAL ("#syriaca-author" or "#syriaca-saint") Designates the person as an author or saint, or both. If both, separate with a space.
note abstract.en: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. (text) A brief description that helps identify the person and distinguish him/her from other persons with similar names. Currently only <note>s with @type="abstract" are supported in the conversion.
sex.Source 1.en: OPTIONAL (e.g., "M" or "F") Whatever you put here will go into the @value of the <sex> element. If the value is "M" or "F", then "male" or "female", respectively, will also be placed in the element content.
state office.Source 1.en: OPTIONAL. (text) Describe's a person's office (e.g., "bishop"), which usually has a definite duration (TEI guidelines). This will be entered as a state type="office" with the content of this column in a "label" element. See the controlled vocabulary under http://syriaca.org/documentation.
state occupation.Source 1.en: OPTIONAL. (text) Describe's a person's occupation (e.g., "historian"), which usually has a definite duration (TEI guidelines). This will be entered as a state type="office" with the content of this column in a "label" element. See the controlled vocabulary under http://syriaca.org/documentation.
state saint.Source 1.en: OPTIONAL. (text) Describe's a person's saint type (e.g., "martyr"), which usually has a definite duration (TEI guidelines). This will be entered as a state type="office" with the content of this column in a "label" element. See the controlled vocabulary under http://syriaca.org/documentation.
relation possibly-identical: OPTIONAL. (Syriaca.org URI) The URI of other Syriaca.org entities with which the person on this row has a relationship. This must be a full URL (including "http://...") if the entity is not a person. If there is more than one URI related to this person, you can separate the URIs with commas. (If the URI contains commas [unlikely], replace them with "%2c".) The conversion automatically uses the value of the column name after "relation_" as the @name of the <relation>, but currently only "possibly-identical" is defined in the column-mapping template.
idno URI: OPTIONAL. (e.g., a URI) An additional identifier for the person (such as a Wikipedia URI). The part of the column name after "idno_" automatically becomes the @type value for the <idno>.
birth.Source 1.en: OPTIONAL. (a human readable date, e.g., "November 405" or "mid-4th cent.") If Google Sheets is wrongly converting your dates automatically, select this column and format the cells as "plain text."
birth when.Source 1: REQUIRED IF the human-readable "birth" column has a precise date. (YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM or YYYY) See "Machine-readable dates" in the Spreadsheet Rules tab. For approximate dates, use the notBefore and notAfter columns instead. Cells must be formatted as plain text.
birth notBefore.Source 1: REQUIRED IF the human-readable "birth" column has a date range. (YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM or YYYY). See "Machine-readable dates" in the Spreadsheet Rules tab. Use this column to specify the beinning of a specific date range, a terminus post quem (e.g., "after ..."), or the outer limit of an approximate date range. See http://syriaca.org/exist/apps/srophe/documentation/dates.html for more details about approximate dates. Cells must be formatted as "plain text."
birth notAfter.Source 1: REQUIRED IF the human-readable "birth" column has a date range. (YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM or YYYY). See "Machine-readable dates" in the Spreadsheet Rules tab. Use this column to specify the end of a specific date range, a terminus ante quem (e.g., "before ..."), or the outer limit of an approximate date range. See http://syriaca.org/exist/apps/srophe/documentation/dates.html for more details about approximate dates.  Cells must be formatted as "plain text."
death.Source 1.en: OPTIONAL. (a human readable date, e.g., "November 405" or "mid-4th cent.") If Google Sheets is wrongly converting your dates automatically, select this column and format the cells as "plain text."
death when.Source 1: REQUIRED IF the human-readable "death" column has a precise date. (YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM or YYYY) See "Machine-readable dates" in the Spreadsheet Rules tab. For approximate dates, use the notBefore and notAfter columns instead. Cells must be formatted as plain text.
death notBefore.Source 1: REQUIRED IF the human-readable "death" column has a date range. (YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM or YYYY). See "Machine-readable dates" in the Spreadsheet Rules tab. Use this column to specify the beinning of a specific date range, a terminus post quem (e.g., "after ..."), or the outer limit of an approximate date range. See http://syriaca.org/exist/apps/srophe/documentation/dates.html for more details about approximate dates. Cells must be formatted as "plain text."
death notAfter.Source 1: REQUIRED IF the human-readable "death" column has a date range. (YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM or YYYY). See "Machine-readable dates" in the Spreadsheet Rules tab. Use this column to specify the end of a specific date range, a terminus ante quem (e.g., "before ..."), or the outer limit of an approximate date range. See http://syriaca.org/exist/apps/srophe/documentation/dates.html for more details about approximate dates.  Cells must be formatted as "plain text."
floruit.Source 1.en: OPTIONAL. (a human readable date, e.g., "November 405" or "mid-4th cent.") If Google Sheets is wrongly converting your dates automatically, select this column and format the cells as "plain text."
floruit when.Source 1: REQUIRED IF the human-readable "floruit" column has a precise date. (YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM or YYYY) See "Machine-readable dates" in the Spreadsheet Rules tab. For approximate dates, use the notBefore and notAfter columns instead. Cells must be formatted as plain text.
floruit notBefore.Source 1: REQUIRED IF the human-readable "floruit" column has a date range. (YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM or YYYY). See "Machine-readable dates" in the Spreadsheet Rules tab. Use this column to specify the beinning of a specific date range, a terminus post quem (e.g., "after ..."), or the outer limit of an approximate date range. See http://syriaca.org/exist/apps/srophe/documentation/dates.html for more details about approximate dates. Cells must be formatted as "plain text."
floruit notAfter.Source 1: REQUIRED IF the human-readable "floruit" column has a date range. (YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM or YYYY). See "Machine-readable dates" in the Spreadsheet Rules tab. Use this column to specify the end of a specific date range, a terminus ante quem (e.g., "before ..."), or the outer limit of an approximate date range. See http://syriaca.org/exist/apps/srophe/documentation/dates.html for more details about approximate dates.  Cells must be formatted as "plain text."
